jrigby.openstack_queue.server

Class ResourceQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractQueue<E>
        • java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingDeque<ResourceRequest>
          • jrigby.openstack_queue.server.ResourceQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Iterable<ResourceRequest>, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Collection<ResourceRequest>, java.util.concurrent.BlockingDeque<ResourceRequest>, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<ResourceRequest>, java.util.Deque<ResourceRequest>, java.util.Queue<ResourceRequest>

    public class ResourceQueue
extends java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingDeque<ResourceRequest>
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Closeable
    The job queue. Coordinates job execution and ensures the cloud resources are used within the predefined limits.
    Author:
    jason
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • serverSchedulingThreadPool

        private final java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService serverSchedulingThreadPool
        Thread pool that limits the number of servers being concurrently created. This setting is defined in a configuration file.
        See Also:
        ServerSettings

      • runningJobThreadPool

        private final java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService runningJobThreadPool

      • isRunning

        private boolean isRunning

      • connection

        private OSConnection connection

      • serverSchedulingTimeLimit

        private java.lang.Long serverSchedulingTimeLimit
        Limits the amount of time spend waiting for a server to start. Servers that take longer than this are presumed to have failed. This setting is defined in a configuration file.
        See Also:
        ServerSettings

      • maxServerCreationAttempts

        private int maxServerCreationAttempts
        Limits the number of retries if a server creation attempt fails with an unspecified error from Nova. This is not the same as a server failing because there are not enough cloud resources available This setting is defined in a configuration file.
        See Also:
        ServerSettings

      • instanceQuota

        private int instanceQuota
        Sets the maximum number of VM instances allowed. This setting is defined in a configuration file.
        See Also:
        ServerSettings

      • coreQuota

        private int coreQuota
        Sets the maximum number of cores allowed. This setting is defined in a configuration file.
        See Also:
        ServerSettings

      • runningJobs

        private java.util.Map<JobStatus,ServerCollection> runningJobs
        Maintains a list of jobs that are currently running

      • startingJobs

        private java.util.Set<JobStatus> startingJobs
        Maintains a set of jobs that are waiting to begin in addition to the jobs waiting in the queue. These jobs are either being scheduled or provisioned.

    • Method Detail

      • startQueue

        public java.lang.Thread startQueue()
        Starts the queue thread
        Returns:
        the thread running the queue

      • run

        public void run()
        Queue polling loop. Runs until the queue is closed.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • acceptableRequest

        private boolean acceptableRequest(ResourceRequest request)
        Checks if a job will fit in the project allocation and, if necessary, adjusts the job size to fit. This will be within the ranges allowed in the ResourceRequest. If the method returns true, it is possible that the maximum node number has been reduced to a lower number, but not lower than the minimum number of acceptable nodes.
        Parameters:
        request - the job request
        Returns:
        true if it will fit, false if not

      • close

        public void close()
        Shuts down the queue, and all running jobs
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • allocate

        private void allocate(ResourceRequest request)
        Creates the required instances for the job to execute, and if successful, runs the ResourceProvisioningCallback.onSuccess(ServerCollection) method of the ResourceRequest callback via ResourceRequest.doSuccess(ServerCollection). If for some reason resources cannot be allocated, ResourceProvisioningCallback.onFailure(Throwable) is called via ResourceRequest.doFailure(Throwable). This method is synchronized because is calls OSConnection.doVMGarbageCollection(), which will kill any VMs that are in the process of starting. Therefore, this method is NOT thread safe.
        Parameters:
        request -

      • allocate

        private org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server allocate(java.lang.String serverGroup,
                                                     org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Flavor f,
                                                     java.lang.String imageId,
                                                     org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.KeyPair keyPair,
                                                     java.lang.String[] securityGroups,
                                                     java.lang.String availabilityZone,
                                                     org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.options.CreateServerOptions... serverOptions)
        Allocates a single server
        Parameters:
        serverGroup - the server name prefix
        f - VM flavour
        imageId - OS image ID
        keyPair - SSH key pair
        securityGroups - array of security groups to apply
        availabilityZone - availability zone in which the VM should be created
        serverOptions - additional server options
        Returns:
        a Server object

      • serverCreatedSuccessfully

        private boolean serverCreatedSuccessfully(org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server s)
        Checks if the server was created successfully. This method will block until the server status is known or until a timeout threshold is reached.
        Parameters:
        s - the Server object
        Returns:
        true if successfully created
        See Also:
        getServerSchedulingTimeLimit()
